definition: to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: He who is ashamed when hearing others singing his praise is a person who is of self-knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 聞聽溢美之詞感到羞愧的人最有自知之明。

sentences.english: They tried to please him with fulsome compliments and extravagant gifts.
sentences.chinese: 他們想用溢美之詞和奢華的禮品來取悅他。

sentences.english: Her arrival was announced with unrestrained razzmatazz.
sentences.chinese: 在無數溢美之詞中人們宣佈了“她”的到來。

sentences.english: Everyone knows the virtues of the internet and, at this point, can even harmonize its praises.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都知道互聯網的優點，甚至可以糾正溢美之詞。

sentences.english: Thank you, President Gu, for that most flattering introduction.
sentences.chinese: 顧校長，感謝你充滿溢美之詞的介紹。

sentences.english: So many words of praise has become Tiger has always been human use.
sentences.chinese: 於是虎成了許多溢美之詞，歷來爲人所用。

sentences.english: We -- don't want to sound cliché, but I’m just your average Joe.
sentences.chinese: 我們不想聽那些溢美之詞，我就是平平常常的喬。
